children.name: eye
children.definition: one of the two organs in your face, which you use to see with : mắt
examples: He has no sight in his left eye.
She's got beautiful green eyes.
color
shape/position
showing your feelings/character
COMMON ERRORS
►Do not say 'black eyes' when you meandark brown eyes. You normally use 'black eye' when someone has a bruise around their eye, after being hit by someone.
-eyed[suffix] having eyes describled
blue-eyed/ one-eyed/ bright-eyed/ bug-eyed etc
a brown-eyed girl

children.name: brown/blue/grey/green
examples: Both their children have blue eyes.

children.name: dark brown/pale brown
examples: His eyes are dark brown.

children.name: deep blue/pale blue
examples: She looked into his deep blue eyes.|The tiny child 's pale blue eyes stared up at her appealingly.

children.name: hazel
children.definition: pale brown and slightly green or golden
examples: He was a quiet, kindly man, with hazel eyes.

children.name: sleepy/tired
children.definition: alsowearyliterary
examples: He rubbed his tired eyes and yawned.

children.name: moist/watery/tearful
children.definition: full of tears
examples: Bethan’s eyes grew moist as she talked about her family.

children.name: sad
examples: He gazed at her with sad eyes as she slowly walked away.

children.name: cold/cruel
children.definition: unfriendly or unkind
examples: He smiled, but his blue eyes were cold and cruel.

children.name: big
examples: She looked at me with those big brown eyes.

children.name: small
examples: His small cold eyes seemed full of menace.

children.name: round/wide
examples: The children gazed at the screen, their eyes wide with excitement.

children.name: narrow
examples: He has a thin face and narrow eyes.

children.name: bulging
children.definition: round and sticking far out
examples: His bulging eyes made him rather look like a frog.

children.name: beady eyes
children.definition: small round and bright, and noticing a lot of things
examples: His beady eyes darted around the room.

children.name: deep-set
children.definition: far back in someone's face
examples: Mac’s eyebrows were thick and dark, above deep-set eyes.

children.name: close-set
children.definition: close together
examples: He had a small nose and close-set eyes.

children.name: wide-set
children.definition: wide apart
examples: Claudette studied the wide-set eyes that looked so innocent.

children.name: sunken
children.definition: having fallen inwards, especially because of age or illness
examples: The man's eyes were sunken, with deep black rings around them.

children.name: sleepy/tired
examples: His eyes looked sleepy.|Her hair was a mess and her eyes were tired.

children.name: sad
examples: Her beautiful eyes suddenly looked sad.

children.name: tearful/moist/misty
children.definition: feeling that you want to cry
examples: As she left a village, people waved at her with tearful eyes.

children.name: bright
children.definition: happy or excited
examples: the bright eyes of the children

children.name: cold
children.definition: unfriendly and not showing any emotion
examples: Her eyes were cold and uncaring.

children.name: red/bloodshot
children.definition: red because you are upset, tired, ill etc
examples: My mother's eyes were red from crying.

children.name: puffy
children.definition: swollen because you are ill or upset
examples: The girl's eyes were puffy and full of tears.

children.name: soulful eyes
children.definition: showing strong emotions, especially sadness
examples: The dog looked up at her with big soulful eyes.

children.name: wild/mad eyes
children.definition: very angry, afraid etc
examples: He stared at them with wild eyes.

children.name: hungry/greedy eyes
children.definition: showing that you want something very much
examples: The men looked around the room with their greedy eyes.

children.name: open your eyes
examples: I slowly opened my eyes.

children.name: sb’s eyes open
examples: Suddenly his eyes opened.

children.name: close/shut your eyes
examples: Joe closed his eyes and tried to get back to sleep.

children.name: sb’s eyes close
examples: She let her eyes close for just a moment.

children.name: rub your eyes
examples: Anna rubbed her eyes wearily.

children.name: shade/shield your eyes
children.definition: protect them from a bright light or the sun
examples: They gazed out to sea, shielding their eyes from the sun.

children.name: narrow your eyes
children.definition: partly close them, especially to show that you do not trust someone
examples: She narrowed her eyes at him suspiciously.

children.name: sb’s eyes narrow
children.definition: become half closed, especially because someone does not trust another person
examples: Her dark eyes narrowed for a moment.

children.name: sb’s eyes widen
children.definition: become more open because they are surprised
examples: His eyes widened in shock.

children.name: sb’s eyes sparkle/shine
children.definition: show that they are very happy
examples: Jenny’s eyes sparkled with excitement.

children.name: sb’s eyes light up
children.definition: become excited
examples: His eyes lit up when I mentioned the word money.

children.name: drop/lower your eyes
children.definition: look down at the ground
examples: The servants lowered their eyes as the countess walked past.

children.name: avert your eyesliterary
children.definition: look away from something
examples: He averted his eyes from the body.

children.name: keep your eyes open
children.definition: prevent them from closing
examples: I was so tired I could hardly keep my eyes open.

children.name: have/keep etc your eyes glued to something
children.definition: be watching something with all your attention
examples: Ted sat with his eyes glued to the television.

children.name: sb’s eyes are full of tears
examples: When she put the phone down, her eyes were full of tears.

children.name: sb’s eyes are full of hatred/fear etc
examples: The prisoners stared at him, their eyes full of hatred.

children.name: eye make-up
children.definition: make-up that you put on your eyelids or eyelashes
examples: She never leaves the house without lipstick and eye make-up.

children.name: eyebrow
children.definition: the line of hair above your eye : lông mày
examples: Do youpluckyour eyebrows (= remove some of the hairs to change their shape) ?
He's got reallybushy(= thick) eyebrows.

children.name: eyelash
children.definition: any of the short hairs which grow along the edges of the eye : lông mi
examples: long/ falseeyelashes

children.name: eyelid
children.definition: either of the two pieces of skin which can close over each eye : mí mắt
examples: Hiseyelidsbegan todroop(= close, because he was sleepy ).
The room spun. Hereyelids fluttered(= moved up and down quickly )and she fainted.

children.name: crow's feet
children.definition: narrow lines around the outside corners of your eyes, that appear when you get older :vết rạn chân chim
examples: She smiled, crow's feet gathering at the corners of her eyes.

children.name: optic nerve
children.definition: the bundle of nerve fibres (= structures like threads) that pass signals from the retina at the back of each eye to the brain : thần kinh thị giác

children.name: pupil
children.definition: the circular black area in the centre of your eye, through which light enters : con ngươi, đồng tử (trong mắt)
examples: Pupils contract in bright light, and dilate in darkness.

children.name: lens
children.definition: the part of the eye behind the pupil (= the black hole at the front of the eye) that helps you to see clearly by focusing (= collecting) light onto the retina : thủy tinh thể

children.name: eye socket
children.definition: one of the two round, low areas on each side of the nose which contain the eyes : hốc mắt

children.name: retina
children.definition: the area at the back of the eye that receives light and sends pictures of what the eye sees to the brain : võng mạc

children.name: eyeball
children.definition: the whole eye, including the part that cannot usually be seen : cầu mắt, nhãn cầu
examples: The surgeon uses a wire speculum to retract the eyelids to expose the eyeball.

children.name: sclera
children.definition: the white layer that covers the outside of the eye : màng cứng

children.name: the white of the eye
children.definition: the part of the eye that is white : lòng trắng
examples: Don't shoot until you see the whites of their eyes (= until the people are very close to you) .

children.name: beady
children.definition: (of eyes) small and bright, especially like a bird's eyes : sáng
examples: His beady littleeyeswere fixed on the money I held out.
She's always got her beady eyes on what I'm doing (= She watches me closely) .

children.name: deep-set
children.definition: describes eyes that are far back in the bones of the face : sâu hoắm
examples: the young man had deep-set eyes
